text: hi there! I have some data stored in a hubdb table. in this case, a list of services that are globally offered. when editing a webpage, I want to give my users the ability to specify which records to reference from this table in the page builder. is that possible?
Hey <@U3A4KEWK1> Finally I just found out that I'm not able to make it work... even if I select the option 1 only, both options are printed into the page... Any clue why?

Hi there. Trouble here inserting a new row into a table with a foreign key (= to another one). So, ended up deleting the foreign key and using a number (= as the id of the other table I want to relate to...) but don't really like this workaround... anyone with some advice or more luck than me?
what issue did u face inserting with foreign key?

You need send forign id values like
```{id: "3545123067", name: "C1L2", type: "foreignId"}```
You can check the example requests in network tab in hubdb ui..
wait where... have been looking here <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/hubdb/v2/create_row>
I think the example for foreign id are not there.. I will add it in few days.
you can check in chrome network tab when updating hubdb ui
